content.description: Really nice, hard boulder. Sit start with left hand on a triangle side pull and right hand on a crimp on the face to the right. Feet are low on some edges. Find the right body position and fire up right hand to an awful mono pocket. I can only fit 3/4 pad of my middle finger  in the pocket then I crimp on the edge with the other fingers. Lock off and find feet. Move up and left to a decent side pull then hit the lip and make a hard mantel to top out. Full value for such a short problem.
content.protection: Perfect landing. One pad is fine.
content.location: First boulder you see when walking up the trail from the Bouchard cabin.

content.description: Cool boulder in a quiet setting. You’ll never see anyone unless they are lost.
